title: After 20 years, family favourite The Gruffalo set for new adventure
description: Author Julia Donaldson says she was spurred to write it by a campaign to reverse a decline in children's reading.

title: Lorde: 'Working with Charli XCX kicked me into opening up'
description: Lorde announces her fourth album after featuring on the remix of Charli XCX's acclaimed Brat.

title: After 20 years, family favourite The Gruffalo set for new adventure
description: Author Julia Donaldson says she was spurred to write it by a campaign to reverse a decline in children's reading.

title: Lorde: 'Working with Charli XCX kicked me into opening up'
description: Lorde announces her fourth album after featuring on the remix of Charli XCX's acclaimed Brat.

title: Robert De Niro shows support for transgender daughter
description: "I don't know what the big deal is," says the US Hollywood actor.

title: Counter-terrorism police investigating Kneecap videos
description: The Metropolitan Police say there are 'grounds for further investigation' into the videos.

title: 10 of the best TV shows to watch this May
description: From Tina Fey's new relationship comedy to an action drama from the creator of Lost, and the return of Sarah Jessica Parker in the third season of And Just Like That...

title: Robert De Niro shows support for transgender daughter
description: "I don't know what the big deal is," says the US Hollywood actor.

title: Counter-terrorism police investigating Kneecap videos
description: The Metropolitan Police say there are 'grounds for further investigation' into the videos.

title: 10 of the best films of 2025 so far
description: BBC film critics Caryn James and Nicholas Barber pick their cinema highlights of the year so far, from a brutal war epic to an ambitious period vampire drama.

title: 10 of the best TV shows of 2025 so far
description: From the latest season of Severance to the UK miniseries that got the world talking and a new hit medical show, we pick the year's greatest programmes to stream right now.

title: The true story of the first-ever 'rock star' chef
description: A new Apple TV+ series explores the life of the so-called "King of Chefs and the Chef of Kings" – shown as a wild enfant terrible who blazed a trail for future generations of cooks.

title: Thunderbolts* is 'the greatest Marvel in years' ★★★★☆
description: The latest in the superhero franchise "is scrappy, scruffy-looking, down-to-earth fun", with a "charismatic" Florence Pugh at its centre.

title: Why Sinners has become a box-office sensation
description: Ryan Coogler's vampire film had an extraordinary second weekend at the box office. It's a victory for a wholly original big-budget film in a cinema landscape of familiar franchises.

title: Aldrich Ames: The most damaging double agent in US history
description: The CIA officer spent nearly a decade selling secrets to the Soviet Union, leading to the deaths of at least 10 Western agents. In 1994, the BBC spoke to one of the spies he betrayed.

title: The overlooked masterpiece full of coded messages about WW1
description: Esoteric and pioneering, the paintings of a lesser-known Pre-Raphaelite, Evelyn De Morgan, explored the trauma and meaning of war – and prefigured current fantasy art.

title: The gory Shakespeare play that makes people faint
description: Titus Andronicus is the Bard's most violent work, and a new production is set to be one of the most extreme takes on it yet. It raises the question: why do we watch such brutality?

title: The fake Hitler diaries that fooled the press
description: In April 1983, a British newspaper, The Sunday Times, claimed to be printing an extraordinary historical document. In fact, the forged diaries were an extraordinary hoax.

title: The men behind the Great Train Robbery
description: Twelve suspects were put on trial in April 1964. More than a decade later, several of them talked to the BBC about the notorious heist.

title: How the US dropped nuclear bombs on Spain in 1966 accident
description: After two planes collided, three hydrogen bombs hit a Spanish village, and one fell into the sea nearby. Two years later, villagers talked to the BBC about the terrifying accident.

title: How Bill Gates mapped out the internet era in 1993
description: Gates and Paul Allen launched computing giant Microsoft 50 years ago. In 1993, he talked to the BBC about the online innovations that would define the 21st Century.

title: The true story of The Great Escape
description: In March 1944, 76 officers broke out of a German prisoner-of-war camp. In 1977, a key member of the escape team talked to the BBC about the mission, and the Hollywood film it inspired.

title: Jean-Luc Godard on the film that changed cinema
description: Stylish and experimental, Breathless heralded a new era of film-making when it was released 65 years ago. In 1964, its director told the BBC why he broke every rule he could.

title: 'One to one' with John Lennon and Yoko Ono
description: BBC's Tom Brook explores never-before-seen footage and shares his personal connection with the new documentary.

title: Why Elton John burst into tears after recording a song
description: The musician explains a heavy moment thinking about the lyrics of a song from his forthcoming album.

title: Chris Pratt on having Arnold Schwarzenegger as his father-in-law
description: The US actor reveals his rituals with his famous father-in-law, including "letting him win" at chess.

title: The strange origins of daylight savings time
description: An insect hunter from New Zealand named George Hudson is responsible for our clocks changing twice a year.

title: Brooke Shields on mature beauty
description: Katty Kay talks with actress Brooke Shields about her life, career and ageing.

title: Green Man Festival silent on Kneecap inclusion
description: There are calls to remove the rappers from the line-up after several other venues cancel gigs.

title: Film festival celebrates region's textile history
description: The Alchemy Festival in Hawick includes a film looking at the role of textiles in the Borders.

title: Woman completes granddaughter's unfinished novel
description: Lorraine Martin promised herself and her granddaughter that she would finish her book.

title: BBC Proms to return to Bristol Beacon
description: The classical orchestra concert returns to the city in August.

title: Mod clothing exhibition set to open in Brighton
description: The In Crowd: Mod Fashion & Style 1958-66 opens at Brighton Museum on 10 May.

title: 'Playing Celine Dion on stage is a lot of pressure'
description: Lauren Drew, 32, from Port Talbot, plays the star in Titanique the musical in London's West End.

title: More Kneecap gigs cancelled after 'kill your MP' controversy
description: A ticket site for the Irish rap band's gigs in Hamburg, Berlin and Cologne confirms the summer shows are no longer going ahead.

title: Stone lion sculpture gets facelift to match twin
description: The lion at the gates to Weelsby Wood in Grimsby has had its face changed to match its partner.
